On scientific publications co-authored by myself

Guido Huyberechts

Modified

August 19, 2025

Introduction

Reading and writing, sharing scientific knowledge gathered through research is one of the corner stones of the advantage of science. Not always, mainly in an academic environment, but a lot of research in not published, often from industrial environments.

I am a non-academic scientist, a lot of the research work was not funded by government grants or community money, and mostly carried out in bilateral projects under non-disclosure agreements. Not too much possibilities for publishing there as well.

So the list below might look short for a lifetime of research, it is only a fraction the work carried out. And it is what it is, a list. A bunch of references that can be used to fill the reference lists of other articles, maybe.

I can point to articles where our contributions to projects were used, without quoting the contribution. Even where the approach is referenced, but to irrelevant publications not of our hand.

Well, it seems people are loosing confidence in a peer review system. I think it is not the only problem.

As I do not expect/intent to publish in journals, the following list can be considered pretty final (apart from some additions when I would rediscover missing articles)

The list

People interested in complete lists by third parties can have a look at:

  • Google Scholar

At the time of writing it mentioned a total of 1437 citations, with an h- and i10-index of 15 and 21 respectively. So be it. It depends who’s counting.

  • ORCID
  • Web of Science
  • Scopus

Research thrusts

As I am not interested in the ranking on the list itself (shouldn’t these indexes not be weighted or corrected taking into account the impact factor of the journal that published the article and of the journals that reference it?) I cluster the publications into research thrusts. Research topics that mainly reflect to affiliation in a certain period of my career. This allows me to elaborate a bit more on the topics, and in fact the most interesting subjects (my personal taste) are not always the ones catching the most interest (or citations, or likes …).

For each of the thrusts I plan to share a story (or more …).

Chemical kinetics

Sensors

Materials

Methodologies
